name: Desert Pearl Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Desert Pearl on the strength of a recommendation of friends who had stayed there several times. It's a beautiful property that harmonizes with the beauty of adjacent Zion National Park. Great restaurants with excellent meals and drinks, literally within walking distance. The complimentary Zion shuttle stops right in front. Staff very friendly and helpful. We hated to leave.
reviews.title: We couldn't have asked for more.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 4 nights in a groundfloor room overlooking the Virgin river. The reception staff were reasonably pleasant and helpful, the room was large & clean with everything we needed. The Kingsize bed was large and very comfy so we slept well. Bathroom was fine with good supply of toiletries. We did experience some noise from heavy footed people in the room above so would advise asking for a 2nd floor room although having made such a request, in advance, we were not given one. Swimming pool area is set out nicely with a good size pool, clean and warm and catches the sun all day. Hotel is about 10 minute walk in either direction to restaurants. Ate mainly at The Spotted Dog both for breakfast and dinner and found it to be very good in terms of price, service and quality. Although you have to pay extra for orange juice and coffee at breakfast they have a good selection of food and compared with other places in Springdale the price is very competitive.
reviews.title: Good hotel within walking distance of restaurants

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved everything about the Desert Pearl Inn. The location couldn't be more convenient to Zion National Park, and the shops and restaurants in Springdale are all within walking distance. Our room had a beautiful view of the Virgin River and the mountains; one morning a deer came right up onto our porch! The room was spacious, tastefully decorated, and spotless. The staff was friendly and helpful, and their recommendations for hiking trails and nearby restaurants were spot on. We won't hesitate to recommend it to others, and we plan to come back as soon as we can.
reviews.title: Highly recommended!
Beautiful setting, Wonderful accomodations
reviews.text: Had a wonderful room with a fabulous view of the mountains from our terrace. Loved everything about the room and the whole place. Only positive comments about the hotel. It was very convenient located. Caught the bus to go into Zion National Park right out front. Great place to stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Desert Pearl is indeed a gem. We stayed in a riverside room that was meticulously appointed with all the amenities needed for a most comfortable and enjoyable stay.
reviews.title: Stupendous setting and accomodations.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for two nights during a short visit to Zion National Park, We had a room overlooking the Virgin River. We found this location particularly peaceful when reading a book from our room patio and hearing the sound of the river. The room and grounds were immaculate. There is a small coffee/gift shop that was served great homemade pastries and coffee. Once parked at the DP, we either caught the shuttle to the park or walked to local dinner locations and a few art galleries..
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay at the Desert Pearl

reviews.text: superlative location. so peaceful to sit on our deck/balcony gazing at the changing colors of the cliffs at sunset reflected on the rushing water of the Virgin River, and soothing to our muscles to sit in the hot tub after a long day of hiking in Zion, and again watching the clouds drift over the cliff tops during another sunset. The room itself gave us tons of room to spread out, the contemporary decor fit right in with all the desert/mountain colors and geology, the amenities were great.
reviews.title: Perfect, beyond my expectations!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Suggestions from the gentleman in the office in the morning were just what we needed, very knowledgeable about the southern Utah area, not just Zion National Park. Fall is a great time to visit! We'll be back!
reviews.title: Comfortable Canyon Retreat

reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel as a model for others to follow. It is spacious, well appointed, comfortable, relaxing, and modern. Large windows looking out at the beautiful views, a tidy kitchen area, large TV easily viewed from anywhere in the room and an excellent value for the dollar. The executive manager assisted us in conveniently parking our truck/trailer on an adjacent property and followed up to be sure it was working for us. The gift shop offered some lovely items as well as a coffee bar to stock up before we headed to the Zion canyon tour. Restaurants were convenient within walking distance and offered great food. I could have stayed here a lot longer, feeling quite at home.
reviews.title: Unique hotel 2 shuttle stops to Zion visitor's center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had a poolside king room on the second floor and enjoyed it for 2 nights. The room is very interesting and unique - rustic wood floors & deck, mixed fabrics, interesting wall art, Ikea style desk/kitchen area, ceramic tile shower, lots of storage. Liked the large frig and small dishwasher, Starbucks coffee for the in-room coffee maker, floor to ceiling windows overlooking the pool, good quality toiletries, large flat-screen tv, very comfy bed with lots of throw pillows. Although the internet is free, the connection was so slow, I got too frustrated and just unplugged. I also used the laundry facilities which are convenient, neat, clean and affordable.
reviews.title: Deservedly number 1

reviews.text: Our family of 4 stayed at the Desert Pearl in August, 2010. We had high expectations after reading the reviews on TA and elsewhere...........glad to say that our expectations were met.
reviews.title: Spectacular

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are fantastic........the small kitchen really enhances your stay. The balcony and chairs were terrific.....wonderful to be able to watch night fall in this beautiful spot.
reviews.title: It's the Little Things

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool area is beautiful.........what a view! The Springdale bus stop is right in front......very convenient. You can walk to many of the popular restaurants in town as well.
reviews.title: Perfect for visiting Zion

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For those on a budget..........the DP is worth it. Spend the money and you'll be glad you did.
reviews.title: Very well maintained property in an excellent location with wonderful customer service!

reviews.text: I don't want to be redundant about the great rooms, location, service, cleanliness, etc., as any reader can see these all rank SUPERIOR from other comments. I thought I'd take a moment to comment on the "little things" that made my stay at the Desert Pearl a MOST PLEASANT experience: Lighted makeup mirror, unique soaps & toiletries, Starbuck's coffee in the room, hot cocoa packets in the amenities basket (this was GREAT after a chilly day of hiking), guest laundry, fully stocked kitchenette (even a corkscrew!), plush towels, bidet, state-of-the art Cuisinart toaster oven, Kitchenaid appliances, ambient lighting, color scheme .... I could go on and on, but you get the point. I recommend Desert Pearl to, well, EVERYONE.
reviews.title: We come to the Desert Pearl Inn, oh, and we also visit Zion.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights from the 8th October purely on the recomendation of tripadvisor reviews - room 406, upstairs river view. We did not want to leave.Peaceful and wonderful view from our balcony. Beds and pillows were the most comfortable we have ever slept in away from home. Pool and jacuzzi were great to get back to in the afternoon after managing Angels Landing - fantastic. Shuttle bus stop right outside hotel, couldn't be more convienient. Will definetley stay here when we vist Zion again.
reviews.title: Everything is True

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our last night of a three week tour of the USA national parks and I was wanting our last night to be memorable - it was!
reviews.title: Paradise in Zion

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Zion is a spectacular place anyway and this Inn was the icing on the cake.
reviews.title: Terrific Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Located in Springfield just outside the national park this Inn has been well thought through. We had a large upstairs apartment with all the necessary comforts overlooking the pool with a mountain view to die for in the background. The sunrise was awesome
reviews.title: Beautiful setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a balcony overlooking the pool which was very relaxing and the room was great.
reviews.title: Great place to stay!

description: A boutique motel on the river's edge just 3/4 mi. from the entrance to Zion National Park. All artfully appointed rooms & suites are no- smoking with numerous up-scale amenities and excellent views of Zion's majestic cliffs from every private terrace / balcony. Our large outdoor swimming pool & spa will soothe away sore muscles after a day of hiking. elements gift store & coffee bar (Starbuck's partner) offers daily, either to stay or take away gourmet drinks & fresh baked in-house items. There is free wifi throughout the property, as well as, a centrally located guest laundry. Also a shuttle stop is conveniently located at the front of the Inn.
